mn72:3.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘sassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:3.1.en: “Mister Gotama, is this your view: ‘The cosmos is eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:4.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘asassato loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:4.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The cosmos is not eternal. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:5.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘antavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:5.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The cosmos is finite. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:6.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘anantavā loko, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:6.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The cosmos is infinite. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:7.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘taṁ jīvaṁ taṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:7.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The soul and the body are the same thing. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:8.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘aññaṁ jīvaṁ aññaṁ sarīraṁ, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:8.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘The soul and the body are different things. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:9.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:9.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A realized one still exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:10.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:10.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A realized one no longer exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:11.1.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho, bho gotama, ‘hoti ca na ca hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:11.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A realized one both still exists and no longer exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”

mn72:12.1.pli: “Kiṁ pana, bho gotama, ‘neva hoti na na hoti tathāgato paraṁ maraṇā, idameva saccaṁ moghamaññan’ti—
mn72:12.1.en: “Then is this your view: ‘A realized one neither still exists nor no longer exists after death. This is the only truth, other ideas are silly’?”
